_meanings:
{@--1@} Black, of a
dark or dark-blue colour.

{@--3@} Fit or opportune time
(to do a thing), proper time or
occasion; (with <ab>gen.</ab>, <ab>loc.</ab>, <ab>dat.</ab>, or
<ab>inf.</ab>); <ls>R. 3. 12</ls>, <ls n="R.">4. 6</ls>, <ls n="R.">12. 69</ls>;
{#parjanyaH kAlavarzI#} <ls>Mk. 10. 60.</ls>

{@--4@} A 
period or portion of time (as the
hours or watches of a day); {#zazWe#}
{#kAle divasasya#} <ls>V. 2. 1</ls>; <ls>Ms. 5. 153.</ls>

{@--6@} Time considered as
one of the nine {%dravyas%} by the
Vaiśeṣikas.

{@--7@} The Supreme spirit
regarded as the destroyer of the 
universe, being a personification of the
destructive principle; {#kAlaH kAlyA#}
{#BuvanaPalake kraqiti prARiSArEH#} <ls>Bh. 3. 39.</ls>

{@--10@}
The black part of the eye.

{@--14@} A
measure of time (in music or 
prosody).

{@--15@} A person who distils and
sells spirituous liquor.

{@--20@} (with the
Jainas) One of the nine treasures.

{@--21@}
A mystical name for the letter {#m#}.

{@--3@} An epithet
of Pārvatī, Śiva's wife.

{@--5@} A woman with
a dark complexion.

{@--9@} One of the
seven tongues of Fire.

{@--10@} A form
of Durgā; {#kAlItanayaH#} a 
buffalo.

{@--11@} One of the Mātṛs or
divine mothers.

{@--15@} A small shrub used as a 
purgative.

a scholar, one who can
read and decipher.

the wood of
that tree; <ls>Rs. 4. 5</ls>; <ls n="Rs.">5. 5.</ls>

{1} the destructive fire at the
end of the world.

having a dark-blue body
(as a sword with a dark-blue edge).
the hide of a black antelope.

a small shrub used
as a purgative.

time, regarded as
the god of death, and the destroyer
of every thing.

an
animal venomous only when 
enraged, as a rat.

period of mourning, 
ceremonial impurity caused by the
birth of a child or death of a 
relation in the family; see {#aSOca#}.

({%a%}) a deadly poison; <ls>Ś. 6.</ls> ({%b%}) the
poison churned out of the ocean
and drunk by Śiva; {#adyApi nojJati#}
{#haraH kila kAlakUwaM#} <ls>Ch. P. 50.</ls>

killing by degrees or slowly (as
a poison)

{1} the wheel of time
(time being represented as a wheel
always moving).

{1} the line of conduct suitable to any
particular time.

{2} the law or rule
of time.

(in astrology)
the figure of a man's body.

{1} the rim of
the wheel of time.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of a 
demon, uncle of Rāvaṇa, deputed by
him to kill Hanūmat.

{3} <ab>N.</ab> of a
demon with 100 hands killed by
Viṣṇu.

ripened by time, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} 
spontaneously; <ls>Ms. 6. 17</ls>, <ls n="Ms. 6.">21</ls>; <ls>Y. 3. 49.</ls>

standing for a time so as
to become stale.

the noose
of Yama or death.

a king of 
Yavanas and enemy of Kṛṣṇa and
an invincible foe of the Yādavas.
Kṛṣṇa, finding it impossible
to vanquish him on the field of
battle, cunningly decoyed him to
the cave where Mucukunda was
sleeping who burnt him down.

according to the requirements
of the time; <ls>Pt. 1. 184.</ls>

{3} the Amāvasyā on which
lamps are lighted (in the Divālī
holidays).

{4} the night of 
destruction at the end of the world 
(identified with Durgā).

{5} a particular
night in the life of man, on the
7th day of the 7th month of the
77th year.

the time of 
Saturn, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} a particular time of the
day (half a watch every day) at 

which any religious act is improper.

a girl 9 years old 
personating Durgā at a festival.

{1} keeping back for a long time;
<ls>Ms. 8. 143.</ls>

{2} lapse of a long 
period of time.

the black and most 
poisonous variety of the snake.

a yellow
sort of sandal wood.
